reviews.sentence: great hotel. good location very comfortable and perfect for business or pleasure.

Exceeded expectations. From the moment I walked in the staff was friendly and helpful. I found parking right in front of the door. The lobby so very nice. I got my room key right away and when I walked into my room it felt like it was an expensive 400 a night resort room. I was on a long drive down the coast and I needed a safe and clean place to stay for 1 night so I was pleasantly surprised with this hotel. The room was huge and clean. Bathroom was huge. The hotel gym was very clean and updated. Parking was free and safe. It was the perfect hotel for all my needs as I journeyed down the coast and the price was under 100. I was stay here again if I am ever in Sacramento.
Nice hotel close to airport and downtown. Stayed only for one night. Early check in and stuff was friendly and helpful. Recommend hotel.
nice hotel close to airport. Great to have dining area in hotel but food was just average. Hotel and staff excellent. Clean and friendly staff Convenient to airport Food.

Average At Best. I expected a lot better from this place. It started with the run down van shuttle that picked me up from the airport. It was falling apart dirty and extremely uncomfortable seats. but I guess at least it was free. Upon entering the hotel the staff was friendly. The elevators were SUPER slow. better off to take the stairs. The fourth floor king bed room looked newly remodeled and was decent although it looked like the remodel ran out of of money. The bed was comfortable and the air conditioner worked REALLY well. The bathroom had decent space and the shower had good water pressure. The desk which looks like it used to cover the air conditioner because of the vents at the back was large but it was turned against the same wall as the wall mounted flat panel TV. Since the TV could not move on the wall it made it difficult to watch TV and work at the desk at the same time. The wifi was pretty decent until the evening then it got boged down and barely worked. The phone in my room did not work so I had to call the front desk from my cell phone. If you do not have a car there is not much around this hotel. There is some food about 34 of a mile away.

Clean and easy access from freeway. TV did not work and night staff unable to fix it. While they offered to move me to an new room I was already settled in and in pajamas. I just did not feel like repacking my overnight items and moving so did not change rooms. Otherwise pleasant stay and property very quiet so close to freeway. Clean quiet and easy access from freeway staffs ability to resolve problems at night.

do not order room service at this run down property. Do not order room service whatever you do. Ordered a BLTC and Panini both with fries. Both sandwiches and fries arrived soggy and with zero requested sauces not even ketchup. The garlic fries simply have garlic powder on them. The panini advertised grilled veggies but the tiny amount of vegetables inside were still cold and raw and the sandwich was not actually grilled just soggy. Both were advertised as 12 each however that did not include tax or mention the delivery charge bringing the total to 37. The pool was tiny and over crowded with lots of children some under the age of four. Not at all as pictured online. The first room we checked into was not actually cleaned with dog hair in the sheets and ten or so different personal items left scattered throughout the room from the previous occupant. The front desk girls were nice apologizing and brought up keys to the new room quickly. The airport shuttle was nice and driver friendly. That was part of the incentive to book the 125 room after taxes and fees. Overall I had never stay here again for this price.
Would definitely stay here again. Came in late from traveling everyone was friendly and the room was great.
The cleanliness and size of the room as well as the quality of the mattress. The room service food was barely average.

Perfect location near Sacramento Airport. Although I only stayed overnight I was happy with everything. From the cheerful friendly check in clerk to the very comfortable and well appointed room. An excellent choice when you want easy on off the highway for airport access. Proximity to Airport. Good bed.

Smooth check in even without reservations. Room clean and comfortable. TV channels readily marked. Shower easy to figure out not one of those fancy ones it takes 10 minutes to figure out and hot water almost instant. Wake up call on time and shuttle to airport every 30 minutes. Just what you would expect need from an airport hotel. Food is mediocre which is really the only drawback and why I did not give them five stars. Having eaten there last time we chose to eat elsewhere.

A mixed bag great location large rooms but uncomfortable bed and poor service. I stayed at this property in May 2017 one night on a business trip. It had high points and low points. The GOOD. Nice new building large clean rooms free airport shuttle bar food on premises. The BAD. 1The bed itself was old sagy uncomfortable. The bedding sheets duvet etc was high end but this was a clearly old and sagy mattress to the point where my back hurt in the morning. It is puzzling that a Sheraton brand at this high of a price point would allow this bed in a room room 28. if that maters2. Service at the front desk was very disappointing. At check in I noticed my corp travel agent booked the room at the full rack rate well over two hundred per night. I asked for the AAA rate and handed my AAA card to the check in guy. He punched some computer keys handed my card back and said you are all set. It is my mistake that I did not ask to initial a documented room rate at that point. At checkout I showed the bill slid under my door still at the full rack rate to the desk agent and asked her to correct it to reflect the AAA rate. She advised that it was already closed and that I should call accounting after 9AM. I called them that day left a detailed voicemail including my AAA number and my phone and email asking for a corrected receipt. Nothing. I called again this Monday same thing. Nothing no response whatsoever. Conclusion. this property has good potential but at this high of a price point I would not stay here again nor recommend it to business travelers. If you stay here Make absolutely sure you initial approve of your room rate at check in. Upon entering your room check out the bed and if it is poor quality then consider asking for a different room.

Not very forgiving. I made my reservation for a day later by accident. They did graciously rent us a room but forget moving the reservation. The front desk said call the reservation line and they said the hotel had the final say. So I stayed one night and paid for two. Make sure you get your dates rightOther than that it is decent if a little spendy for what it is.

Terrible customer service. Front desk clerk was beyond rude. Booked rooms six months in advance for a family reunion. Checked in on Friday morning key did not work Saturday morning. Elevators were shut off due to too much traffic in the hotel. Everyone had a room we booked over 50 rooms in the establishment. Of course we will walk from room to room and mingle. We had family from Colorado Texas Baltimore and southern California. We have elders who could not roam as freely as the rest of us. They were also forced to take the stairs. The front desk clerk refused to give her name in order for corporate to be contacted. Whish they had a zero star and I would have rated them below that. Terrible experience.

Nice place. Friendly staff made it easy to check in and out. They asked if the 1st floor was ok for my room. I prefer the top floor and they had no problem switching it. The room was good sized comfortable bed. I forgot my toothbrush but they had extras. The gym hot tub were nice to use. I left the room key in the room. I was glad they checked my ID before giving me another key. That shows they care about security safety. They had a snack shop pantry that had a good selection of drinks including some good wine. The free shuttle to the airport was very much appreciated. I will stay here again.

What the heck is wrong. OMG. Arrived at 130PM on a Sunday. This hotel is in the middle of nowhere off an exit on a major highway near the airport. Anyway about 7 cars in the parking lot. Go up to the check in counter and the woman simply says Check in is 30. I was dumbfounded. She did not say oh we are at capacity and the rooms are still being preped cleaned. Simply no you can not check in because it is not 30. The place is a ghost town. So I said OK we will go and find some place to have lunch. Well there IS NO PLACE to have lunch unles you want to eat at a Subway. So after driving around and finding nothing we went back to the hotelit is now 20 and a shuttle van from the airport had pulled up and about 4 men were on the line to check in. My husband and I sat down and then watched as each man was handed a key to their individual rooms. We were like WHAT. So I got in line and the woman did not say anything to me but I gave her that look and she gave me my key. If she had not I think I would have given her what for. Anyway we went to a concert that evening and arrived back around 100am. We needed a 50am wake up call to catch our flight. Well the phone in the room did not work. So I went downstairs and they tried calling the room. The phone did ring but when my husband picked up it was dead. So I asked them if THEY could possible put in the wake up call request for me and the woman different from the afternoon said yesThey also said they would try to find a working phone for us. I went back up to the room then returned to the lobby a short while later. They could not find a replacement phone and the woman sheepishly explained to another co worker a guy that she did not know how to put in a wakeup call request for us. So if I had not gone back down we would have never gotten the call. Anyway did not sleep at all that night stressed about waking up in the morning plus all of the pillows were that absolute CHEAP kind that is about 12 inches of foam. HOrrible.
The room we stayed in was okay. We could nt get the hot water to work. I stepped on a carpet tack and put a hole in my foot. Other than that the people were helpful.
Reserved a king size room weeks in advance. Went to check in and was downgraded to a double beds. Service desk was slightly unprofessional when dealing with us. Would not use this hotel again.

This hotel was not my choice to stay in. My company booked it for me for a business trip. When I got here the woman at the front desk checked me in. She was courteous and nice. I got checked in under 5 mins. Which all hotels should be doing. I got my room key and was assigned a room of the first floor. Thank goodness no stairs or elevators lol. When I got into my room it was very clean and tidey. I would stay here again.
Good. Size of the room and bathroom.

Five Stars for Four Points. This property is fully rehabed and decorated ati it looks the best of all hotels in the Sacramento airport area. It is way above its rating. The interior is more like a four star hotel. It feels actually like a boutique hotel. The lobby is inviting and eclecticaly decorated. Rooms are spacious and redecorated. This is a pretty dope hotel. Way above our expectations. Service is very good and all people there are nice and smiling and inviting. The breakfast is pretty good not artificial as with other properties at the airport. Coffee is excellent. They also have a shuttle to the airport which is very convenient. There is also plenty of parking. It is a pretty hip property closer to Aloft than Four Points. The only disapointment is that as a Titanium member they promised me an upgrade but they never delivered.

Convenient comfortable friendly staff clean airport shuttle. Friendly staff at check in and check out clean room super comfortable bed hot powerful shower clean linens. The free shuttle to the airport was great friendly prompt safe driver. However the ground floor room that I was in was at the end of the hall near the stairs and exit door from 10 pm until I left at 745am there was constant noise. Could also hear people walking in the room above. So even though the bed was comfortable the stay was very noisy. The biggest problem was that my card was charged for multiple restaurant charges AFTER I had checked out and left in the shuttle. Thankfully the front desk cleared that with me over the phone the next day. Bokingcom is extremely helpful in finding and reserving hotel romsI did not like my credit card being charged for restaurant charges that were not mine and charged after I had checked out. I did not like all of the noises all through the night very noisy stay.

Bar and restaurant closed front desk staff great. I would have given this property a 3 if not for the front desk staff. M and J were great. Location. Chose this hotel as was near the airport and was flying out the next morning. And because it had on site bar and restaurant which is why I picked it over nearby Hilton properties where I would normally stay. It is less than 10 minutes from the airport. Restaurant and Bar Closed. Was only told bartender did not show up. Poor property management if that causes that kind of closure. Apparently the bartender also served the food from the kitchen which WAS open but only for take away. Would have liked to know this earlier. Room Looked new no complaints. Note they have now gone to refilable bottles for shampoo conditioner bath gel instead of the little bottles. There was an individual bottle of lotion on the sink. Room had coffee maker mini fridge microwave iron board hairdryer. Service As far as I could see there were only 4 employees working yesterday two at the front desk the cook and shuttle driver. When I was checking in was told bar and restaurant were closed but could buy stuff from the pantry including beer wine. And that you could order from kitchen and food could be delivered. Also shuttle driver could take to nearby restaurants. I had work to do and had planned at working in restaurant bar area while eating. Instead ordered at front desk they said someone would deliver. As it turned out one of the desk staff brought my dinner and the other brought the 2 beers I ordered a few minutes later. The front desk staff also helped with some other requests and I have to say they were both very nice and helpful and by themselves took this review from a 3 to a 5. Date of stay was 5292019Aditional Tip If you are returning a rental car there is a gas station just before the rental return at Sacramento airport. Not cheap but convenient.

Very disappointed with my stay. I reserved a King room. Upon check in I was told that there was one available but it was accessible. I agreed to take the accessible room. When we walked into our room it did not have a King bed but 2 doubles instead. The room was very very outdated. Extremely disappointed with the quality of the room for the price I paid.

Surprised Mariot claims this. Not much of a greeting at checkin. Air conditioning took a long time to cool down. Room very clean. TV goes off every four hours. Only person I would give a thumbs up to is the young gentleman who was doing double duty at the bar and kitchen. He was excellent. Not the usual spirit of Mariot. Glad I have other options.

I was surprised that the Four Points was room bigger and nicer than other one I have been in US. Since I am Mariot member I asked for a bigger room upgrade and was happy that I had one. I have stayed at so many Mariot and never get upgraded and this is the first EVER. We booked the rate with breakfasts and wish it was free for everyone since the food are so basic. I have to mentioned that it FREE parking. The staff are friendly and location is very good.

Staff was not very knowledgeable about pool times was told only the hot tub closed at a certain time yet the pool also closed at the same time continental breakfast is not free as with many other hotels but it was nice food tasted great and was hot. Close to the airport so be prepared for lots of air traffic over head nice little dinning area inside. Room doors shut hard therefore it make alit of noise. Other then that i d give the place a 48 out of 5.

Great if you love Fire Alarms. Everything started off fine. We arrived a bit earlier than normal and but our room was ready. Front desk staff was efficient. The look of the place is fairly modern and the rooms have clearly had a cosmetic makeover somewhat recently. The fixtures and physical build out is still dated window mounted central air units. And the room insulation was absolutely terrible. We could hear everything going on in the hallways and adjacent rooms throughout the night. The worst part was the fire alarm going off at 2 am with a siren that knocked me out of bed. OK it is supposed to do that. but it kept going off for some time would stop then went off again. This occurred one more time later that same morning. Was it some drunk person was it a real emergency we had no idea. We could not sleep and had a terrible few hours until we finally gave in and started the day completely exhausted. That morning there was no explanation no note of apology slipped under the door. No one at the front desk during check out so we just left. Never to return.

Not impressed with this hotel at all. Our family opted to stay here over 8 hour layover before 6 am flight. They made it easy with 99 per night fee. So many things went wrong. It was not worth it. First we had to wait 30 minutes at the airport for the shuttle to arrive. When it arrived it was already full before we could get on. The fun continued. Subway advertised on their site closes at 9 pm forcing us to eat in their hotel instead. It keeps going. The walls in this hotel are super thin. It was so bad I could hear people talking in their bed in the room next to us and people walking above us. And now imagine a full hotel due to 99 rate. Chaos. Scheduling our free shuttle for the am turned out to be a challenge. Our preferred time was full 430. The next time 50 was full too. We had to do an UBER instead. This place is a joke. This condensed version. What happened to us was much worse. do not stay here. Go across the highway where the restaurants are.

I had scheduled it for Sunday Monday and not noticing the reservation came back Saturday Sunday. So I had to use my Mariot card for the room. Secondly the showers continually rotated from scalding hot to temperate without being able to adjust. Overall a bad experience to pay for a room I could n’t use and pay again for the same room.
